description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5flm","text":"This is a protocol for the preparation of a microscopy sample of single Alexa Fluor 647 molecules immobilised in PVA polymer on a cover glass. This protocol was used to generate the data shown in Figure 2i and 1j of the following publication:\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":196,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpps2","text":"Bruggeman et al., POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479 (Feb 2023), doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":133,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D18236A7AEFF11EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"9r34o","text":"POLCAM: Instant molecular orientation microscopy for the life sciences\nEzra Bruggeman, Oumeng Zhang, Lisa-Maria Needham, Markus Körbel, Sam Daly, Matthew Cheetham, Ruby Peters, Tingting Wu, Andrey S. Klymchenko, Simon J. Davis, Ewa K. Paluch, David Klenerman, Matthew D. Lew, Kevin O’Holleran, Steven F. Lee. bioRxiv 2023.02.07.527479, doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":309,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":341,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2F00C3C0AF0011EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.07.527479"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fpnro","text":"Argon plasma clean cover glass (VWR collection, 631-0124) for   in a plasma cleaner (Expanded Plasma Cleaner, PDC-002, Harrick Plasma).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a86q","text":"Dilute Alexa Fluor 647 (AF647) to   in the filtered 1% PVA solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"500","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":31}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h5j2","text":"Dissolve   of solid PVA into   of filtered milli-Q water in a glass beaker. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ash","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av79l","text":"Filter  Milli-Q water using a syringe filter (0.02 μm syringe filter, Whatman, 6809-1102).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1flg","text":"Let the solution cool. Once cooled, filter it using a syringe filter (0.02 μm syringe filter, Whatman, 6809-1102). You can store the filtered 1% PVA solution at   for later use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":161,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"44qhp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"es84q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"66kb0","text":"The filter tends to clog if you try to filter too large a volume of 1% PVA in one go. If this happens, filter in separate smaller batches, replacing the filter each time for a new one.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"38jnf","text":"Place a clean cover glass into a spincoater (WS-650Mz-23NPPB, Laurell) and spin-cast   of the AF647 solution onto the cover glass for   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":134,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3vj7v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"coer9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":45,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"3000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":-1,"unit":33}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2u5j7","text":"To avoid forgetting which side of the cover glass the sample was put on, you can use a marker to place a small dot in the corner of the cover glass before spin coating.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n60s","text":"Optional: Seal the sample by sticking it to a standard glass microscope slide (631-1550, VWR) using a double-sided frame-seal slide chamber sticker (9x9 mm, SLF0201, Bio-rad). Make sure the coated side of the cover glass is facing the microscope slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78ssr","text":"Place the beaker on a stirring hot plate and heat the solution to   under continuous stirring for   or until the PVA is completely dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":66,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3FECA280AF0111EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"90","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4B0EBAB2AF0211EEAB870A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"90","unit":10}}}}
